title: Livin' The Dream
description: Dwight becomes regional manager after Andy quits his job, Jim dedicates more time to his Dunder Mifflin job to save his marriage, and Angela has problems with her new living arrangements after her breakup with The Senator.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm taking some time off from work--well, my other work--because we needed it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's great.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's great.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The phone has been ringing off the hook. The guys in Philly are kind of going nuts.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But that doesn't matter. This does. It's the only thing that matters. We've had some really nice days together.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nice morning, too.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Beesly! Oh, my god.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey. Which tie makes me look like a guy who likes sofas? My agent's putting me up for a furniture commercial.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ah, definitely blue.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Totally, right? So, Big Tuna, what's up? Back in the small pond?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: For now, yeah. I was spreading myself way too thin--

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thin-sliced tuna. Carpaccio. Go on.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, well, it took me a while, but I finally realized that I can't give 100% to two things at once you know.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Tell me about it, you know? I've been trying to act and manage this branch. Half the time I don't know if I'm wearing my stage makeup or my work makeup.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Huh. Well, you know, you can't have everything so you gotta ask yourself what makes you the happiest. You just go all in for what's most important. That's my new thing.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [noticing Angela looking very unkempt] Is everything ok?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No. Everything is not okay. The county took my cats.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Wait, all of them?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Two sacks' worth. Apparently my apartment complex has rules about how many pets are too many for a studio. And while I was out picking Phillip up from daycare, they came. They came into my house.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: That's--that's awful, Angela. I'm so sorry.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It's the [bleep] that lives downstairs. She's this uptight, judgmental shrew. You know the type.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I've never met anyone like that.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: And they're gone. And I have no one left. Without my cats, I am utterly and completely alone.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Angela, you still have your son.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I guess.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Attention, everyone. May I have your attention? There are four new deadly weapons in this office. [kicking and punching] Basher, Thrasher, Crasher and--

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Smasher!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Smasher? No, where'd you get that? Fireball. This morning after hours of combat with some of the city's best teenagers I earned my black belt in Goju Ryu martial arts.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I had to find a new dojo after sensei Ira and I parted ways. My new sensei, sensei Billy, thought I had more than enough training to take the test. Turns out, sensei Ira was a bit of a shyster. Sensei Billy says most students don't spend $150,000 over 20 years to get their black belt.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I would like to invite you all to my black belt ceremony, right here in the office at lunch, lunch not provided.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Fireball!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ah! [throws punch] That's how it's done.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's pretty good. I feel safe.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Hey, Erin. Is Andy in?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, is Andy in? Sorry, I thought you said "is Indian" and was like, "Is Indian what?" Is Indian food good? Is Indian jewelry pretty? Is Indian hair an expensive kind of wig? Yes, to all three, by the way.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Lately, I've been having a lot of trouble keeping track of Andy's calendar. His student film audition schedule is crazy hectic.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yes, there's Andy! Andy is in. I'm a good receptionist, I know he's in.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: David Walrus, in his native habitat.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Hey, Andy. Can we go in your office and talk?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: This isn't going to be an easy conversation. I told Andy that he was on very thin ice when he snuck away from three months to the Caribbean. Then last week he used company money to buy a top-of-the-line photo printer. In his words, "The kind that's good for head shots." And yesterday, he asked me to pay for cheek implants. Claimed it's gonna boost office morale. Now, he's a good guy. But honestly, at some point, the ice gets too thin and you fall through. And that is when you get fired.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Andy--

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm gonna stop you right there. David, this documentary is going to air in two weeks. I feel like it's a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to pursue my dream.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Uh-huh, but--

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Every minute that I spend here is time not spent making audition videos for reality dating, cooking or singing shows. I got a real shot here. And I'll never be able to forgive myself if I blew it because I was too focused on my stupid paper company job. No offense.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: So you think you've been too focused on your job?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: At my last head shot sitting, I was so distracted wondering what I was missing at work that I came across totally manic. And I was going for zany.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: So you--you want to quit Dunder Mifflin to pursue acting?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, no, actually. I see no reason to limit myself to just acting. I am pursuing fame of any kind. Could be singing, could be dancing. I don't--it just... I owe it to myself and my future fans.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Uh, well, I guess I can't stand in the way of a man's dream. And it seems like you have the gift.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thank you, David.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: There's probably no way I can talk you into staying at this point, can I?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Nope. I have made up my mind. I'm really sorry.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Well, good luck.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thank you. Not gonna need it.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Well that kind of worked out.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I think just anybody could be a star. My postman, the night janitor here, but Andy? No, definitely not. Charisma black hole.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, Clark. I'm actually here today. Surprise! So I was wondering if I could maybe have my desk back.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Right. Yeah. But, you know, I've actually been working pretty hard here on a daily basis. So, I kind of feel like I've earned this. I mean, you know?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You totally have. You have earned this. But maybe I could be with my wife. Kind of the whole reason that I'm here.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Right. Well, I'm here to sell paper.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: All right, Jim, look, I just got made junior salesman. Right? And--and Wallace is here today. And I don't him to just think of me as a customer service rep that sits in the annex. I mean, you can get that, right? Right? And what do you need more face time with Wallace for? You trying to get a second second job here?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: it's okay. You can sit in the annex.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'll come visit you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. The annex it is. I'll be sitting at your desk if that's okay with you.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: That's fine with me. But be careful, it is very easy to get lost in Pete's beautiful, dead eyes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Everyone, a little breaking news for ya. Just had a little chat with David Wallace. And, um, I'm taking a leave of absence from Dunder Mifflin, forever.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I can't say we didn't see it coming. But it's a sad day when anybody is fired. We're so sorry, Andy.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Uh, uh, uh, uh, Andy was not fired.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I wasn't fired. What are you talking about? I'm fired up, yes. Guys, I'm--I'm leaving to pursue my lifelong dream of being famous.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, so, I'll see you on the red carpet. See, that's how it works.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Andy sings beautifully. And he's really good at dancing. He's a good speaker. But there's just something there you don't want to look at.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, how am I doing as your desk mate, by the way? You probably miss Clark.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Yeah, a little bit.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, wow. But, um--Oh, I get that.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Oh, no, no, no. No it's cool.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I get it.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: It's cool, man. I'm sure you and I will have our own thing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Definitely. Go Phillies, right. You don't watch baseball. I keep forgetting that.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I just think you're going into this a little fast.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm 38, Darryl, how much slower should I go?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Show business is cold. Let's say you get a job, which you probably won't. They're not gonna cut you any slack. You're meant for a job with lots and lots of slack.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: All right. I get it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: The male is a funny species. We don't just tell each other how we feel, that's chick stuff. So instead of saying, "Hey, Andy, I love you, man. I don't want you to leave." You say something like, "Hey, Andy, you're making the worst mistake of your life. You're not talented." Well... right back at you, Darryl.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [hugs Darryl] I'm gonna miss you too. Mmm!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Andy's from the generation that thinks they should all be famous. What happened to the generation that knew you shut up, did your work, and died quietly from a heart attack?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Could Andy make it as an entertainer? I don't know. You know who's really funny? This bird, in the park, that can't fly right. I'd pay to see him. But I don't have to cause the park is free!

quotes.speaker: Sensei Billy
quotes.text: I will now perform the ceremonial changing of the belts.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He will now perform the ceremonial changing of the belts!

quotes.speaker: Sensei Billy
quotes.text: It's not a large room, I think they heard me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Take my belt, master. I now submit to you every part of myself. [thrusts hips at Ira]

quotes.speaker: Sensei Billy
quotes.text: That's really ok. I'm mostly focused on the belt here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Just slip it off my--Slip it off my hips.

quotes.speaker: Sensei Billy
quotes.text: Hold it--Take a step back. Take a step back. [they bow, then Dwight thrusts again] Okay, okay. I can't--I can't do this if you're gonna be thrusting like that, okay? I think we're gonna have to cut this off.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He will now perform the ceremonial cutting-off-of-the-belt.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Dwight has been practicing karate for years. When we were dating, I would help him with his strength training. He would strap me to his chest in a baby Bjorn made for fat children and do lunges across the farm. It felt like I was flying.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There it is. [everyone applauds]

quotes.speaker: Sensei Billy
quotes.text: Congratulations.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We did it, we did it. I love you.

quotes.speaker: Sensei Billy
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thanks. I will now perform my final kata forms. You're gonna watch me right?

quotes.speaker: Sensei Billy
quotes.text: Yes, I will. [Dwight starts doing karate]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sensei, you're not watching.

quotes.speaker: Sensei Billy
quotes.text: Yeah, I'm watching. Just do it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Watching?

quotes.speaker: Sensei Billy
quotes.text: I'm watching.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Watch this part, okay?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Sensei, do you generally do house calls like this?

quotes.speaker: Sensei Billy
quotes.text: Uh, you can just call me Billy. And no. No, but Dwight insisted. He wanted to receive his black belt in the place he loves most in the world.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: He said that? He's an odd guy, isn't he?

quotes.speaker: Sensei Billy
quotes.text: Yes. Irritating, also yes. But I gotta hand it to him, he's one of the most tenacious and determined men I've ever met. [Dwight finishes his routines and everyone applauds]

quotes.speaker: Esther
quotes.text: Oh! I'm am so proud of you, Schru-berry blue.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I really felt like I almost lost her, and--and nothing is worth that.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Well, I gotta tell you, Jim, a lot of guys in my circle? They wouldn't even change their golf schedule to shore up their marriage let alone their professional goals.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Dude, there is no way that Jim is just back here to hang out with Pam.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You did not just say that! You don't know Pam. She is really cool.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: All I'm saying is, forget about my chair. He wants the manager's chair. And I thought you wanted that job.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, I did. But I made too many mistakes. It's out of my reach now. Besides, I think Jim would be a fine manager. I'd be happy to see Jim as manager.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: So, the reason that I called you in here is because Andy is moving on.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Again.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Again! And I'm looking for a new manager. And with his performance this year, I have been considering Dwight. Am I crazy?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Not at all. It should be Dwight.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: You sure?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You're gonna want to invest in a lot more liability insurance, but, uh--

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, if there is someone out there who loves paper more than Dwight, I definitely don't want to meet that person.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Andy, we just wondered if we could have a word.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's now or never.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Well, we just had a quick question about this decision of yours. You know, to leave a stable job and pursue a career in the entertainment business. In your late 30s. With no savings to fall back on. And no real connections in that business, which can be competitive.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, sure. What's your question?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Our question is--it seems dumb.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, it's better than sticking around here and half-assing it, right?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Of course. But what if you were to stay here, you know, and "full-ass" it? Um, really give it a go. Be the greatest manager in the history of this branch and in that way achieve the fame and immortality that you seek. Hmm?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Nah. I like my plan better.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well, Andy, your plan sucks, okay? Nobody is going to hire you ever. You're too character-y to be a lead and you're not fat enough to be a great character actor.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No, I don't think that he can make it as an actor. But, he also can't make it as an employee in an office, so why not go nuts with it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, are you still in charge of office supplies?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I seem to have sticky not emergency where I grab it on the wrong end, and this happens.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, boy. Um--

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: If you could help me out, that would be--

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I could give you some beginner stickies?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Anything would help.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Here you go.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, also, while you're at it, if you did have a salt packet, three tacks and some aspirin, that would be great. Oh, wow. You have that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow, that's--

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's all yours.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You come so prepared. Aspirin.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You wanna get rid of a headache, you sit on something sharp. Any sensei will tell you that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, congratulations on that black belt, man. It's really great.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you. So I saw you talking to Wallace earlier. Is he going to offer you the manager's job?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No. He was maybe thinking of you for it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, right. I'm afraid that ship has sailed.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I wouldn't be too sure about that. Just saying.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, hello.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Big day for you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Big day for you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Love the belt.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, yes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You know, I don't know anything about karate but I have broken a few boards in my day. Diving boards, at my family pool in Redding. I was an obese child. I never talk about that here, but Nard-dog's outta here, so letting it all hang out!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is exciting! You're finally gonna get to go out and flap your wings.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thank you, I appreciate that. 'Cause a lot of people are saying I might not make it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, I doubt you'll make it. Very few do who've tried to be a star. But, listen, you've saved up enough money to take a couple of years off to pursue your dream and have some fun, right?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, I just applied for more overdraft protection.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Andy, I have nothing to gain from getting you to stay, and everything to gain from you leaving. But please, I have known you for years, I have seen you perform. Dear god, don't quit your day job.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [cockney accent] Nothing is impossible to him who will try. [normal] Alexander the Great, if he were cockney.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're bad.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm gonna make it. Every person that has been on Conan has a crazy story about how they made it. Every person.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Erin. Honest Erin, cannot tell a lie. We lay together. That's something you can't take back.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: So true. Is there a question, or are--what?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Will you tell me bluntly, do you think I am making a terrible mistake quitting my job to become an actor?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Bluntly? Yes. Huge mistake. Andy, honestly, I think you might become homeless. Or maybe even starve.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thank you. [steps into conference room]

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: You can stay on as a salesman, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thank you. [leaves]

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Dwight, could you come in here for a second, please?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Say it again.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Will you be the new manager?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Where?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Where?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What branch?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Here. Scranton. [Dwight falls to his knees] Come on. Come on, Dwight. Get up. Let's go. It's good news.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm sorry. I've just waited for this moment my entire life. I mean, I was interim manager once, but then I shot that gun.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But this isn't interim manager. No. It's Dwight K. Schrute... [pulls a business card out of his wallet] Manager.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Why do you already have this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: In case Michael or Andy ever got killed in a traffic accident and there was a trade show on the same day. You will not regret this decision, David.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I will never, ever let you down.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: I know, Dwight. I know. [reaches out to shake Dwight's hand, Dwight hugs him] Okay. Okay. All righty. You're gonna do great.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow, hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What's up?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, I have a question.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, I had a question.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I did!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, totally you did.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Super important.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I need you to stay right here while you think about it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right? I'm gonna wait.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: All right. I did not come back here just to see you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm sure you did not. What was your question?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't know, but it might take me a long time to figure it out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, then, I should figure out things to do while I'm waiting.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Exactly.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, everybody, I changed my mind. Not leaving. I'm gonna stay on in sales.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, thank god. Because sales could be your best role yet.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hey, good choice, man. Seriously. Don't want to see you in a porn next year.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Ooh, there's a great play about a salesman.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Death of a salesman.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I don't think so.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Sure, 'Death of a Salesman' by Arthur Miller, it's a great play about crushed dreams.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No, this one was written by Spongebob Squarepants.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [sits at Dwight's desk] Got any hot leads?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: See, so you just push from under, and turn it around, and boom. No the staple crimps outward.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I had no idea. And here I've been stapling the same way for 20 years like a frickin' sheep.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Look who's back.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm back. Oh, hey, look, and now it's like a double date.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Wow. Cause, uh [gestures to him and Erin and then to Pam and Jim with sound effects]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Actually, maybe we should go on a double date some time. That'd be fun.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, we should do that for real sometime.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Well, how about Thursday?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, well, Thursday's tough, because of--

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Weeknights are actually tough just because--

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: They are.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's true, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Just forget it. Forget I said anything.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Attention, everyone, just a quick announcement. Little reconfiguration to the staff. Dwight Schrute--

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: David. Can I just do one thing while you're making this announcement and then I'll never, ever do it again?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: I don't think so.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's just one thing. Just let me--let me do this--

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Dwight, Dwight, Dwight. Come on--what I was about to say was Dwight--[phone buzzes] Oh, I'm sorry, I gotta--This'll be a second, sorry.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Just wait and send it to voicemail.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on. Come on.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: [on phone] Then we'll get him a new set of drums.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [climbs up on desk] Dwight Schrute is manager! [everyone cheers and applauds]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Brava, brava.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [from atop his desk] Creed Bratton is the new manager! [nobody responds]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What's going on?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Dwight's the new manager. He freaking did it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [hugs Dwight] Congratulations, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pam.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [hugs Dwight] Congratulations, buddy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Congrats, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Get out of Jim's seat.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: But I fought for this seat.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're an annex kid. You might be bullpen, we'll see. Give it a couple of years. Scram.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's nice to have you back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I wanted to offer you a new position.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Let's hear it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Assistant regional manager.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope. Can't accept that job. It's not a real job.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'll tell you what I could accept is assistant to the regional manager. That is a real job and one I'd be proud to take.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Shake on it? Done. Way to negotiate, idiot.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Don't get me wrong, I am definitely here for Pam. But this is an awesome added bonus.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So, all the numbers adding up?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey, I didn't get a chance to say it, but... congratulations, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes. Congratulations.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, and Dwight, I'd like to be the first to say congratulations.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: This is a big day for you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, it is. Carry on.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: How did I just abandon my dreams so quickly? It's cause I had a fallback. That's the problem. When you have fallbacks, it's just easy to give up. When Cortez landed in Mexico, only way he got his men to defeat the Aztecs was by burning all of his own boats. So they could never return home. Huge dick move but very effective. I need to be that same kind of dick to myself.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Everyone! Changed my mind again.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What's it now, dream or no dream?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Uh, dream. Goin' with my dream. Gotta go all in, isn't that right, Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, don't look at me cause I think you're making a terrible choice.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: All in! Whoo!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Toby! Hey, I changed my mind again. I am gonna leave Dunder Mifflin to pursue acting after all.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Okay, then, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, but here's the thing. I can't have good old Dunder Mifflin to fall back on or else I'll never succeed. Gotta burn those boats! So I need you to go into my file and put down that I was fired for theft and/or groping wieners.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Andy, you know I can't do that. It'd be lying.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Seriously?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah, I'm--

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Come on, just do it.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I can't.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: All right, fine, just know that you made me do this. [starts touching Toby's thighs]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [fending Andy off] Oh, come on. Andy, no.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: God, Toby, don't--stop blocking my hand.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: No, no.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This is your--you brought this on.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: No, no. Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay, all right. Groped you good. Off to Hollywood!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [answering phone] This is Angela. Oh. Hello, Miss Polodnikovski. Uh, how can I help you? Did my rent check not clear? Because I just transferred another $25 to that account. So if there's a problem it's clearly on your end. And--oh. Oh. Oh, okay. Good. Then... um... what is this about? No, no. Hey, hey! No, you are out of line Miss Polodnikovski. No, no you are. No you are! Evicted? Fine! I didn't want to live in that cesspool anyway! Listen, I get my security deposit back. Yes, I do. This is not fair! That is not fair! Well, you know what? You have so many hairs on your chin that Animal Control should've taken you away. That is very unladylike! You are disgusting! [hangs up phone]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What do you think that was about?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: David. I lost the Scranton White Pages account. Do you have any idea how much paper that is? And I'd just like to point out, I was mad at Dwight. I did it out of spite.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: We put the past behind us, though, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What if I told you that I hate you and I hate this company?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Enough, Andy. Enough!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Just stop forgiving me, David, please? This is my last chance to honor what is best inside myself. What if I took a dump on your new car?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Oh my god.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Eleanor Roosevelt once said 'the future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.' [clip of him flipping off David Wallace] I think she's right. [clip of David Wallace yelling at Andy to get out] I feel calm now. [clip of Andy taking a dump on a car] I feel, like, for the first time in a long time, I'm doing the right thing.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Uh, heavy stuff like books on the bottom. So it don't squash my knickety-knacks on top.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yeah, okay. That's not what I mean. You don't have to leave because you said you would. Don't let pride ruin your whole life. Okay? It's not worth it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Wow. Angela. What we had was great, and, honestly I think about it a lot too--

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Ugh.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: But I just--it's in the past. And I feel like we shouldn't...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, that's not--

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Rehash--

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, none--No, stop. It's just--

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Exactly.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Okay. Well, have a good trip. Good luck, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thanks, Angela. You too.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: A-bridge, a-burnt. No turning back now. Everybody, Lorelai and I would like to say thank you and goodbye the only way we know how.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, good lord.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Can't you just leave?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know, Andy, you could just say a really nice goodbye.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Tuna, I'm a performer. And perform I shall. [sings 'I Will Remember You'--everyone is slightly impressed]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [whispering] You okay?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [crying] It's just a really nice song.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [everyone applauding] Awesome!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Who knows? Maybe Andy will make it. He's not terrible.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Yeah. And people worse than him make it all the time. Like Lil Romeo.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: No, he's good.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: He was good.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Good night, Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Night, Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Tents? Are you thinking of going camping? I thought you found nature vulgar.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Well, I've changed my mind.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Wait a minute. You're not thinking of living in a--

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh, god, could you just mind your own business?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Okay, I'm just gonna say this. You are not going to live in a tent.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh, god.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Come stay with me.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You don't want me at your place.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I do. Yes. Not forever. But until you get back on your feet. Which won't be long. It's the least I could do.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Separate bathrooms.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You're welcome. Let's go get Phillip. Then we'll get your stuff...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: And get you the hell outta that place.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Are you allowed to have pets?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Oh, Angela.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yesterday I was just your average, ordinary paper salesman with a farm and a bunch of pipe dreams about beet fuel. Today, I leave here a regional manager with a black belt. It really is amazing how your life can change in one day.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You talk to Wade and Colin?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I just saw I missed their call. Why? What's up?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: We got an offer on the table.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What kind of offer?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: A buyout.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: We're in play, baby.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, my god!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: We did it! Hey, and look, the buyers wanna make sure it's not just a Philly play, so get this: they're gonna pay for us to go pitch out west. We talking Spurs, the Jazz, Cowboys. Blake Griffin, baby.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow, that is... wow.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah, we did it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, we did. Hey, how long--how long do we think that's gonna take?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Wade said we could do the whole country in three months.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, man. Yeah, I can't do it.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Can't do what?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: This, man. I can't do this to Pam.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No, no, Jim. This is different. This is everything.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I know. And I can't do it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: So is your place all bachelor-slobby and gross?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No, it's neat and tasteful, like most gay men's homes. The stereotype holds up.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I wouldn't know. I never lived with a gay guy.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Angela, you just were--

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [starts sobbing] I love him.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I know. I understand more than most, but we both have to move on. You--you can't--

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, not the senator. I love Dwight.
